page.title: 04GARSDON FARMING CONTINUED
page.content: Most of the crops around here are wheat and barley but rape is also grown. These are harvested the same way but maze is cut by a special machine. When harvesting a long time ago, there had to be about twenty people to do one field but now we have machines, it only takes two people to harvest a field. The machines are called Combine Harvesters and Tractors and Trailers. The silage, the grass cut during spring and summer for animals to eat in the winter, has to be kept under cover. This is usually made of black plastic. This keeps the silage dry as the cattle will not eat the silage if it is wet.
